metadata.title: CVE-2019-9518 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 20.04 LTS (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
Some HTTP/2 implementations are vulnerable to a flood of empty frames,potentially leading to a denial of service. The attacker sends a stream offrames with an empty payload and without the end-of-stream flag. Theseframes can be DATA, HEADERS, CONTINUATION and/or PUSH_PROMISE. The peerspends time processing each frame disproportionate to attack bandwidth.This can consume excess CPU.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-9518` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

trafficserver - 8.0.5+ds-3
trafficserver-experimental-plugins - 8.0.5+ds-3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: netty package in focal is affected and needs fixing.
trafficserver package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '8.0.5+ds-3').
